p: Pancreatic lipase inhibition was determined using the modified method of Kim et al. (2007) using p-nitrophenyl butyrate (NPB). Briefly, the enzyme solution was prepared by adding 30 μL of lipase solution from porcine pancrease Type VI-S (Sigma-Aldrich). This solution was composed of 10 mM morpholinepropanesulfonic acid and 1 mM ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid (pH 6.8) in 850 μL of Tris buffer (100 mM Tris-HCl and 5 mM CaCl 2, pH 7.0). Yogurt extract (100 μL) was mixed with an enzyme substrate solution (880 μL) containing 10 mM p-NPB and incubated for 15 min at 37°C. The absorbance of the sample was measured at 400 nm using an ELISA reader (Synergy 2; BioTek Instruments) and was compared with that of the control buffer solution, without the extract.
